metadata.title: CVE-2022-48753 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: block:fix memory leak in disk_register_independent_access_rangeskobject_init_and_add() takes reference even when it fails. According to thedoc of kobject_init_and_add() If this function returns an error,kobject_put() must be called to properly clean up the memory associatedwith the object. Fix this issue by adding kobject_put(). Callback functionblk_ia_ranges_sysfs_release() in kobject_put() can handle the pointer"iars" properly.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48753` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
